One national NGO driver was shot and killed at a teashop by unknown armed men in Xiniinyo Warsangeli area, Bari region.
One UN national staff was stabbed during a robbery while he was walking to catch a taxi in Kabul.

One female INGO national staff was assaulted and taken to an isolated area in Pibor town by an alleged Lango age-set group where she was injured. The woman managed to escape and was medically evacuated.
One national INGO worker was killed by Murle Tribesman near a nutrition project site, in Duk Pagaak, Duk County.
One INGO-contracted driver and his assistant were injured when their vehicle carrying commodities was ambushed and shot by unknown armed people along Gadiang - Yuai road, in Payuel Payam, Duk County.
One NNGO director was kidnapped by an unknown group in Magway while travelling. He was held for 20 days.
Two ICRC aid workers were kidnapped by unknown actors between Gao and Kidal, Gao region. The aid workers were released on the 19th of March.

One national NGO aid worker was injured by unknown armed actors during a violent robbery near the Meteorology Station in Bissau when returning home after a night out. Three UN mission staff were also robbed (not counted).
One INGO staff member was shot in the leg while standing in front of the office building in Dinsoor, Bay region. He was taken for medical treatment and has since almost fully recovered.
Two INGO aid workers were ambushed and kidnapped by unknown actors when returning from a food distribution in Kikonde, Fizi, South Kivu.
One male national UN aid worker was kidnapped at his house by unknown actors in Port Au Prince for economic purposes. The aid worker was released on March 14th.

One international volunteer and one national were wounded when a Russian rocket hit a minibus carrying humanitarian aid travelling from Bakhmut to the city of Chasiv Yar, Donetsk Oblast. The international staff died from their injuries on March 27.

Two UN-contracted drivers were hit by gunshots when five trucks were left behind from a big convoy and later ambushed by armed Murle Tribesmen in the Thiam area, Duk county. One contracted was killed and the other seriously injured.

One aid worker was killed, one wounded, and two drivers are missing when four commercial UN-contracted trucks were attacked by armed Murle Tribesmen when returning from the Greater Pibor Area to Bor Town, Jonglei.
One international contracted UN truck driver was shot dead when reportedly Murle Tribesmen ambushed a convoy of 6 trucks who had delivered food in Gumuruk county.
One national UN aid worker was assaulted and injured by criminals in his home in Torit, Eastern Equatoria.
One off-duty national INGO aid worker was injured during a robbery by unknown criminals at the compound in Bentiu IDP camp.
One national UN aid worker was injured when a group of IDPs allegedly pelted him with stones while on duty in Malakal, Upper Nile.
One INGO driver was injured after a physical altercation with an unknown individual in Raqqa.

One UN contractor driver was shot and wounded and another UN-contracted driver went missing when their vehicles were reportedly ambushed by unknown armed men along the Yuai-Gadinag in Payuel Payam, Duk County. The convoy reportedly left behind an escort from the UN Force Protection that was to escort the vehicles back to Bor.

One UN agency local contractor was reportedly, ambushed, assaulted, and robbed of personal belongings by suspected men from Panyuon section of the Agaar Dinka community, along the Puornengdit-Rumbek Road in Toch Area, Amongpiny Payam, Rumbek Centre County.
One male locally recruited NGO staff member was abducted and tortured to death by a group of armed youth in Malual Gahoth Boma of Malual Payam.
One male national INGO aid worker was injured by a stray bullet during crossfire in Cite Soleil, Port au Prince.
One national INGO contractor was injured by the intoxicated partner of an aid recipient with a machete while doing home visits in Jocotan, Chiquimula.
One aid worker was killed in the conflict sometime between April to June in Khartoum, Sudan.

One national Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid worker was seriously injured when the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) attacked his ambulance and an Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) stationed at the Bab Al-Asbat area, near Al-Aqsa Mosque. In addition, the Israel Defence Forces (IDF) shot a sound bomb at the ambulance, breaking the mirror on the driver's side.
Three drivers in UN-contracted vehicles were ambushed and injured by unknown actors while moving in a convoy from Yuai to Bor along the Gadiang-Bor Road in Payuel Payam, Duk County.
One national female UN polio vaccination worker was shot dead by unknown actors in Mogadishu while going house to house informing about the polio vaccination campaign.
One ambulance driver and one mid-wife from the Ethiopian Red Cross were shot and injured when unknown armed men attacked their ambulance in Abscia, Amhara region.

Two INGO national staff members were shot and killed in a crossfire between the Ethiopian Federal Defence Forces (ENDF) and Amhara Regional Special Forces in Kobo, Amhara region. The driver and the security officer were traveling from Mekelle to Kombolcha.
One national female INGO worker was killed in North Kivu. The aid worker was off duty, on her way to a voting registration centre.

One national INGO staff was shot dead when unknown men attacked a commercial vehicle carrying goats along Kapoeta-Camp 15 Road. The body of the aid worker was found naked nearby. Two other civilians sustained gunshot wounds.
One INGO staff member sustained serious injuries during a multi family dispute.
One donor government official was shot and wounded during clashes between the Sudanese Armed Forces and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Khartoum.

Three UN employees were killed and three injured in clashes between the Sudanese Army and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Kabkabiya, North Darfur. The incident caused the temporary suspension of operations of the organization.
One national male INGO worker was killed in the ongoing clashes between the Sudanese Armed Forces (SAF) and the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in North Darfur.
One INGO aid worker was reportedly sexually assaulted by unidentified perpetrators in Khartoum.
One UN national staff was shot and injured when Rapid Support Forces entered his house and looted it in Amarat, Khartoum. The RSP fired other gunshots and stole mobile phones.
One UN male national staff was injured due to a projectile explosion during clashes between the Sudanese Armed Forces and the Rapid Support Forces in Zalingi, Central Darfur.
One off-duty national UN aid worker was injured when criminals entered his family house, threatened him and asked for his money in Bo, Southern.
One UN staff member was injured by shrapnel after his house was hit by shelling in El Obied.
One male national UN staff was killed when the vehicle he was traveling with his family was caught in a crossfire between confronted parties in El Obeid, North Kordofan.

One male national INGO aid worker was assaulted and injured when unknown individuals entered his home and attacked him while he was sleeping. The reason for the attack was reportedly revenge motivated.
One male UN aid worker was kidnapped by the Rapid Support Forces in Khartoum. The aid worker was released 21 days later.
One national UN guard was kidnapped by unknown armed actors during a raid on the agency's facilities in Benisheik, Borno State. His whereabouts remain unknown.
Two UN contracted drivers, one on duty and one off duty, were attacked by gunmen travelling in Oromia and injured.

Three national INGO aid workers were abducted at their guest house by a group of militants of the Islamic State in West Africa (ISWA) in Ngala, Borno State. On May 4th, two of the three aid workers were found unharmed by the Nigerian Armed Forces.

One UN agency contracted driver was killed during a road ambush by unidentified armed individuals on the Ajakkuac-Abiemnhom road at the Ariel Zain Tower, Abiemnhom County. Two other drivers were robbed but not harmed.

One on-duty NGO security guard was assaulted, injured, and locked up in a room inside the NGO facility compound by three unknown armed men who gained illegal access in the Gendrassa area, Boung Payam, Maban County.
Two NNGO contracted drivers were attacked by an armed group who lit their vehicle on fire. One driver was killed and the other was seriously injured.
One local male INGO staff was killed while off-duty by unidentified perpetrators in Ag Geneina city, West Darfur state.
Two aid workers were killed in Ag Geneina by unknown actors at the end of May.
One INGO staff member sustained a head injury from a physical attack by an unknown man in Damaturu town.
One female national INGO staff was sexually assaulted by another staff member at a project site in Malakal.
One INGO staff member was killed when his private vehicle came under fire during an violent operation between two different NSAGs.
One UN contracted driver was injured, taken to an unknown location, and later dropped off in a remote area when unknown armed men intercepted the vehicle in Al Sumayah IDP camp, Ma'rib governorate.
One male national INGO aid worker was injured by a stray bullet during a crossfire in Portail Leogane, Port au Prince.
One female staff was injured during an attempted rape at a hotel in Koui by PMC Wagner Group soliders.

Two INGO aid workers were injured when a group of unknown youths attacked their ambulance in Burato area, Jonglei. One former health minister from the Greater Pibor Area was also injured during the attack (not counted).
One INGO aid worker was injured at home due to nearby explosives.
One national INGO aid worker was killed in his home by three armed youths in Ulang, Upper Nile. Allegedly, the motive was related to a revenge killing.
One female national UN aid worker was shot and killed by unknown armed men in Masemu. Another civilian (non-UN driver) was also killed during the shooting (not counted).
One national INGO aid worker was killed by unknown armed actors in Zalingi, Central Darfur.
The body of a national NGO staff member was found with stab wounds near Yad village.
One female international INGO aid worker was sexually assaulted in her home in Kapoeta, Eastern Equatoria.
One INGO aid worker was killed in Nyala, South Darfur.
One national INGO aid worker was injured by a stray bullet at the organisation's compound in Mueda.

One national INGO driver was killed by unidentified perpetrators during an ambush in Birao, Vakaga region. Two other INGO workers managed to escape, and the vehicle was taken to an unknown location, but was later found.

One national INGO aid worker was shot and killed, and two national INGO aid workers were injured with sticks when 10 Murle Tribesman of the Kurenen age-set ambushed them between Pibor Town and Tenet Village.
Two national UN staff were physically assaulted by the South Sudan Defence Forces (SSDF) after being detained in Pageri Payam, Magwi County. The aid workers were released the same day.

Actor name: Islamic State of West Africa Province
Details: One NGO worker was killed by Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) members in Damasak, Borno State.

One national UN male aid worker was beaten and injured with electric shocks by a group of armed personnel wearing the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) uniform, after intruding into the UN worker's residence in Zalingi, and started questioning the identity of the staff member. Later the perpetrators started searching and damaging the house and looted unspecified items. One civilian who was present in the house was also injured (not counted).
One male national Sudanese Red Crescent aid worker was killed due to a shelling attack that hit his house in Gabra, in south Khartoum.
Three INGO national staff members were injured by suspected armed individuals from Ikotos County while traveling to deliver seeds to farmers in Chukudum, in Komori Payam, Budi County.
One NNGO bulldozer driver was injured when a landmine exploded while working in Afrin, Aleppo.

Five NGO staff members were kidnapped by Al Shabaab militants on the road between Farlibah village and Beledweyne, around Morodiile, Hiraan. They were all released over a week later after a ransom demand.
One national INGO aid worker was seriously injured during an incursion to his home by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Omdurman, Khartoum.
One national male INGO aid worker was killed by unknown armed men while off duty in Ag Geneina.
One national INGO aid worker was stabbed to death by unknown actors in Renk, Upper Nile.
One national male INGO aid worker was injured during a robbery by unknown criminals on the Magburaka highway, Nothern province.
One nationally recruited INGO aid worker was stabbed to death by unknown armed actors in Renk town, Upper Nile.
One national NGO worker was abducted by suspected JNIM militia men in Niangassagou village, Mopti.

One UN female aid worker was killed during a siege by Al Shabaab members in Lido Beach, Mogadishu. Eight other people were killed, and 10 were injured, including members of the Somali security forces and civilians.
The founder of an NNGO was killed by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and Janjaweed militias in Ag Geneina, West Darfur.

The head of a NNGO was kidnapped by unknown armed men while travelling by motorbike to Lusenda, Fizi territory. Allegedly, the kidnapping occurred following a disagreement on a road project and the perpetrators asked for a ransom. His travel companion was also kidnapped and tortured but released a few hours later (not counted). The aid worker was released on June 17th after the ransom was paid.
One aid worker was killed in Central Darfur.
One NNGO contracted driver was shot and killed by unknown armed men as he was trying to get his truck unstuck from a river near Charokol village, Ikotos.
One male UN agency local national staff member and one female local national aid worker were physically assaulted by a local person in Marol Market, Makuach Payam, Bor South County.
One national INGO security guard was killed at his home, along with his family by a shelling attack in Khartoum.
One UN staff member was killed as him and his family were evacuating near the Chad border.
One aid worker and one driver from an INGO were injured when an aid recipient threw stones and broke the doors of the car they were in, in Babati, Manyara.
Two national NGO contractors and the driver were kidnapped by Al Shabaab near Bansoole village, Buur Hakaba, Bay due to their NGO affiliation.
An INGO female national staff was injured after an unknown person threw a stone at their vehicle breaking the glass in Mahagi.
One INGO aid worker was killed by angry workers when trying to mediate over a wage dispute in Gazipur, Dhaka.
One female INGO aid worker was injured by two criminals on a motorcycle who robbed her personal belongings in Madale village, Kinondoni, Dar Es Salaam.
One female national UN worker was kidnapped by unknown actors in Taraba. Her whereabouts remain unknown.
One national NGO aid worker was killed by unidentified armed men in Beni city, North Kivu province.
One female NGO aid worker was reportedly injured during Russian shelling near Makiivka.
One national UN aid worker was injured during a criminal robbery of his residence in Mvolo Payam.
One national UN aid worker was kidnapped while off-duty by criminal actors on the road between Fort Liberte and Montruis, in Les Gonaves, Artibonite. The aid worker was released on July 6th.
One NGO consultant was kidnapped by JNIM militants along with a vehicle in Bintagoungou village, Tombouctou region.
One INGO driver was kidnapped by criminal actors in Delmas. His whereabouts remain unknown.
5 healthcare staff supported by an INGO, at the Las Anod General Hospital were injured due to shelling.
One national NGO aid worker was killed by shelling from the Syrian Armed Forces in Atareb, Aleppo.
One INGO national staff member was assaulted and injured for unknown reasons by a FACA soldier in Kaga-Bandoro. The perpetrator later harassed the family of the victim.
One INGO contractor driver was kidnapped while driving from Port-au-Prince to Gonaive in a rental vehicle. His whereabouts are unknown.

One UN agency international staff member was injured when a local juvenile reportedly attempted to steal a UN jacket in Wau Town, Wau South Payam, Wau County. They received medical attention at a UNMISS hospital.
One INGO aid worker was stabbed and injured by criminal actors on his way home in Oromiya. His personal belongings were stolen during the incident.
Two national NGO aid workers were killed by unknown actors in the Afar region.
One national NGO aid worker was killed by unknown actors in Amhara.

18 INGO aid workers were physically beaten and whipped by unknown armed men in southern Khartoum while attempting to bring supplies to a hospital. The armed men also threaten the life of the driver and stole a vehicle.
One international UN aid worker was shot and killed while leaving a restaurant in Turbah, Aden, by unknown armed men on a motorcycle.
One INGO driver was injured when unknown armed men opened fire on the vehicle he was driving near Dhobley town, Afmadow, Lower Juba.
One national male UN aid worker was kidnapped for economic purposes by unknown criminals in Port au Prince. The aid worker was released on September 2nd.
One UN IDP staff member was stabbed by a member of the 'One Heart' gang in IDP Camp 3 near the UN House compound.
One national NGO aid worker was beaten during an ambush on their vehicle traveling from Gumuruk to Pibor, Jonglei.
One Palestinian Red Crescent Society medical staff was shot and injured by the Israel Defence Forces while on duty in Askar Camp.
One female international NNGO aid worker was kidnapped with her child at the project site of the organization in Port au Prince. The nurse and her child were released on the 9th of August.

One INGO staff member was kidnapped in the hospital area of 'Camp 3', Cox's Bazar, by an unknown armed group. He was asked to join the group, and was beaten when refused. He was reportedly released after a ransom payment was made.

One UN staff member was injured during the clashes between Jund al-Sham, Shabab al Muslim and Fatah in Ain al-Hilweh refugee camp. The confrontations killed at least 13 people and injured around 40 (not counted). The UN agency temporarily suspended its activities in the camp.
One doctor was killed and five medical staff were wounded when an INGO-supported hospital was shelled two times by the Russian Armed Forces in Kherson city, Kherson Oblast.
One male national INGO staff was kidnapped from his home in Nyala and later killed.
One national NNGO contractor was abducted by JNIM militiamen along with a vehicle in Bintagoungou, Goundam, Tombouctou. His whereabouts remain unknown.
One national NGO staff was kidnapped along with two vehicles by JNIM Militia in Niafounke, Tombouctou. His whereabouts remain unknown.

One male INGO aid worker was physically assaulted by soldiers from the Somali Armed Forces after refusing to add them to the list of beneficiaries at the Jakaton IDP camp, in Baidoa. The program was temporarily suspended due to the incident.
One INGO male national staff member was injured when an unknown person threw a stone at their vehicle breaking the glass in Djugu.
One national aid worker was shot and wounded by unknown armed men in Dori, Sahel region.
Three NGO aid workers were injured when their ambulance was hit by mortar rounds during a combat between the Dhulbahante clan and the Somaliland security forces.
One national NGO driver was abducted when the Dulmi-diid clan militia entered Daba Goryaale village and carjacked two NGO-owned vehicles in the Togdheer region. His whereabouts remain unknown.
Three INGO aid workers were abducted by unknown armed men in Mushegereza, Uvira, South Kivu. The victims were released on August 14th.
One INGO staff member was kidnapped by RSF forces and forced to work in a RSF military medical facility in Khartoum.
One male president of an LNGO was shot dead by unknown armed men while sitting in front of his office in Pyin Oo Lwin, Mandalay.
One UN staff member, off-duty and at home, was kidnapped by unknown armed for ransom in Beledweyne, Hiraan. He was held for more than 24 hours, but released unharmed.

One UN aid worker was wounded by Tariq Saleh's forces in an aid distribution centre in Al Khawkhah, Al Hodeidah. The attack occurred because of the organisation's refusal to include the names of some people of the armed factions.
One INGO contracted security guard was injured while on duty when four unknown armed men entered the INGO nutrition site and looted food supplies in Malakal, Upper Nile.

Actor name: Unite pour la paix en Centrafrique (UPC)
Details: Two national NGO aid workers were kidnapped by Unite pour la Paix en Centrafrique (UPC) members on the Zemio-Mboki axis, Haut-Mbomou region. Both aid workers were released on August 20th.
One local NGO aid worker was wounded by shelling from the Russian Armed Forces in a residential area of Chasiv Yar, Donetsk Oblast.
One local NGO aid worker was killed, and one local NGO aid worker was injured when a missile from the Russian Armed Forces hit the centre of Chernihiv city.
One national NGO aid worker was kidnapped and later killed by unknown actors in Bittou, Centre East region.
One national UN staff member was injured by an unknown armed individual in Rumbek town, Lakes State.
One INGO aid worker was killed along with two other civilians by allegedly the Rapid Support Forces in Zalingi, Central Darfur.

One INGO driver was abducted by an unknown armed group when driving between Nedjo and Nekemte, Oromiya region. The occupants of other three vehicles were also abducted in the same attack (not counted here). The driver was released three days later.
Two international aid workers were abducted by unknown armed men in Ma'rib province. Their whereabouts remain unknown.
One NGO aid worker was injured with a machete by criminal actors who robbed the house in Kalemie, Tanganyika.
One national INGO aid worker was kidnapped and beaten by the Rapid Support Forces in North Kordofan. The aid worker was released days later in West Darfur.
Two national INGO aid workers suffered injuries during a shooting to the public boat they were onboard in Toumbouctou.
One INGO staff member was injured after being hit by a stray bullet in Markada.
Four INGO national aid workers were abducted by unknown men in May-Safi village, Rutshuru territory, North Kivu. They were released several days later after random was paid.
An INGO aid worker, driver, and NNGO staff were kidnapped during an ambush of their vehicle by unknown armed men between Gao and Ansongo. The kidnappers asked for a ransom for their release.
One female INGO staff member was killed when her civilian transportation boat came under fire between Gao and Tombouctou, by the NSAG JNIM. 63 other civilians were killed (not counted here).
One NNGO aid worker was abducted by unknown armed people on the road between Kob and Bara, Gao region. He was released on September 12.

One international female director of an NGO and one international staff of the same organisation were killed by a Russian missile when entering Bakhmut in a vehicle to evacuate civilians. Two other international male staff members of the NGO were also injured.
One UN aid worker was injured during an attempted robbery by three criminal men in the residential area of Tomping, Juba, Central Equatoria.
One INGO aid worker was kidnapped by Houti Forces and killed around 45 days later, in Amanat Al Asimah, Sana'a. The INGO suspended operations in the region after the incident.
One NNGO aid worker was abducted from his home by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in his home. His whereabouts remain unknown.
One male UN staff was wounded in his house by Local Agar Dinka community members over a personal dispute in Rumbek, Lakes state.
Two emergency room staff were kidnapped by Rapid Support Forces (RSF) members in Khartoum city from a hospital, along with four other civilians (not counted). They were released 2 days later.
One INGO driver was injured due to a crossfire close to the Main Canal of Sukkur, Sindh.

One national male NNGO aid worker was kidnapped by the Dawei Defense Team (PaKaPha) and the Dawei guerrilla in Launglon, Dawei district, allegedly due to his association with the military forces. The aid worker was released on September 26th.
Two NNGO aid workers were killed by unknown people reportedly due to a personal dispute in Ananatak Payam, Tonj East, Warrap state.

At least two female off-duty nurses and two male off-duty volunteers of the Red Cross were abducted by the Kachin Independence Army (KIA) while going between Sinbo town and Myitkyina town on a ferry boat. Official reports indicate two were later killed.

One national LNGO aid worker was detained and tortured in interrogation by the Myanmar Armed Forces, allegedly due to his connections with the local resistance forces, in Lawksawk township, Taunggyi district, Shan state.
One national NGO aid worker was shot and seriously injured by an unknown armed individual over a personal dispute in Wunlit town, Wunliit Payam, Tonj East County.
One off-duty male INGO aid worker was kidnapped by M23 militants in North Kivu along with another civilian (not counted). Both individuals were released on September 26.

Two international UN-contracted drivers were killed and one international UN-contracted driver was injured when their convoy was ambushed by unknown armed men on the Yei-Juba Road, Lainya, Central Equatoria. Two trucks of the convoy were burnt.
One male president of a local NGO was abducted by unknown resistance forces in Shwebo, Sagaing. An ambulance was seized during the attack. His whereabouts remain unknown.

70 UN aid workers have been killed and 22 have been injured during the clashes between the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between October 7 and October 31, 2023. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.
One female LNGO aid worker was shot and killed in her house by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF). Another woman was raped during the attack (not counted).

One NNGO driver was shot and injured during an ambush by unknown armed actors at the Tohubac area, between Camp 15 and Lobira, Budi County, Eastern Equatoria. Another aid worker managed to escape (not counted).
One national NGO driver was injured during an ambush by youths in the Inkas area, Torit, Eastern Equatoria.
One male NGO volunteer was killed in a Syrian Armed Forces rocket attack on Idlib city on October 6, 2023. The rockets struck a public street location where the aid worker was standing.
One national UN implementing partner was killed by unknown armed men in Roam Payan, Nasir County.
One national NGO aid worker was injured when a shelling hit a public location in Daret Izza, Aleppo. Two other civilians were injured and one civilian was killed in the same incident (not counted).
Two male National Red Cross Society (Magen David Adom) aid workers were killed while on duty during the attack on Kibbutz's on October 7.
One IFRC National Society (Magen David Adom) ambulance driver was shot and killed by Hamas when driving an ambulance in Ofakim, Israel.
One female NGO aid worker was killed by Hamas during the attack on the Be'eri kibbutz.
One IFRC National Society (Magen David Adom) senior volunteer was shot and killed by Hamas in his home during the attack on the Be'eri kibbutz.
One IFRC National Society (Magen David Adom) female paramedic was shot and killed by Hamas while providing health assistance to the people attacked in the Be'eri kibbutz.
One LNGO contractor was stabbed to death by unknown actors in Nasir, Upper Nile.

One UN staff member was kidnapped by an unknown armed group in Luberivi, Uvira, South Kivu after a 2 vehicle UN convoy was ambushed travelling the Uvira-Sange road. The staff was released on October 12th.
One IFRC national society staff was reportedly kidnapped from a Kibbutz in Southern Israel while providing medical assistance and later died in Gaza.
During a city-wide Syrian Armed forces rocket and artillery strike on Idlib city, 2 NGO staff members were injured and 2 others were killed from three different organisations.

Two health workers from an INGO-supported hospital were killed in a shelling in Omdurman, Khartoum. Five patients were also injured in the attack and needed to be transferred to other facilities (not counted here).
Two NGO health workers were kidnapped by JNIM militants between Gourma-Rharous and Tombouctou, Tombouctou region, during an ambush. Another civilian was also kidnapped (not counted).
Four Palestinian Red Crescent Society paramedics were killed when the ambulances they were in were hit by an aerial attack in the Gaza Strip.
One Palestinian Red Crescent paramedic was shot and killed at the Karni crossing in eastern Gaza.
One local UN staff was kidnapped by Luo youths who demanded the government release their leader in exchange for the release of the UN staff in Wau, Western Bahr el-Ghazal.

Two INGO national staff members were kidnapped by OLA armed men on October 12 when travelling from Negelle to Hawasa. Following interventions by authorities and local elders they were released 2 days later.
One female INGO staff was shot and killed at a project site in Zalingi, Darfur.
One INGO staff member was injured after a man, not chosen as an aid recipient, attacked him in Saighan.
One male INGO aid worker was assaulted and injured by a member of the community in Watawala.
One male INGO national staff was killed in Almar, Faryab.

One national male NNGO driver ambulance died in custody after being arrested at the Za Wea Village checkpoint on the 30th of September and held in a compound in Auk Kin Village, Tanintharyi region. Allegedly, the aid worker died of the injuries sustained from torture.
One female national INGO aid worker was killed by a rocket strike on the Church of Saint Porphyrius in Gaza.

One male INGO aid worker was killed during captivity by the Houti Forces in Sana'a. The aid worker was in the custody of the armed group since the 9th of September. The INGO suspended operations in the north of Yemen due to this killing.
One male INGO aid worker was shot and killed in his house by unknown armed people in Gondar, Amhara region.

One female INGO guard was abducted and beaten by unknown armed actors on her way to the duty station in Chittagong. She was released the following evening and taken to the hospital for severe physical assault.

One male INGO aid worker and resident of the POC camp was kidnapped by members of the Agwelek forces - Sudan People's Liberation Army-in-Opposition (SPLA-IO) in Eastern Malakal Payam, Malakal County. His whereabouts remain unknown.
A senior UN aid agency staff was injured due to shelling from the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) in Khan Younis, Gaza Strip.
One NNGO aid worker was kidnapped by a non-identified NSAG in Colombia. The aid worker was released the next day due to community pressure. The NGO suspended activities after the incident.

One Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid worker was injured when his ambulance was targeted by an Israel Defense Forces (IDF) strike at the entrance of Al-Shifa hospital, Gaza Strip. The ambulance was the second one targeted during the same attack. Other civilians were also injured (not counted).
One INGO staff member, travelling in a civilian SUV near the town of Amuda, was hit by a drone strike and killed.
One international organisation contractor was killed along with his family during an airstrike in Gaza.
One national INGO aid worker was killed along with his family in his house during an airstrike in Gaza City.
One INGO aid worker was shot and killed when unknown armed men attacked a humanitarian vehicle on the road between Ansongo and Gao.
One INGO aid worker was shot and killed by unknown armed men while travelling by foot between Nyaka and Jebel Bumaat, Pibor, Jonglei after his vehicle got stuck.
One national NGO aid worker was killed and another was wounded when unknown armed men attacked their vehicle in Gargouna town, Gao.
One male INGO staff member was killed after his home in Al Shati refugee camp was bombed.

According to media reports 20 Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid workers were injured on duty between the 7th of October and the 7th of November in the Gaza Strip. Eight emergency vehicles have also been put out of service due to the damage caused by airstrikes.
One national INGO aid worker was stabbed to death on the road to Nyaat town, Jebel Boma county, Jonglei region. The perpetrator and the reasons are unknown.
One male INGO aid worker was injured by a drunk relative of a beneficiary in Bilaspur, Chhattisgarh.
One national NGO aid worker responding to a measles outbreak was killed by unknown actors after a community field visit in Boma, Pibor, Jonglei.
One national INGO aid worker was shot dead by unknown armed men between Wau and Kuajok, Jur River County, Western Bahr el Ghazal. Allegedly, the aid worker was killed due to his birthplace.
One UN aid worker was injured by a gunshot when two criminals on a motorcycle robbed the staff member's personal belongings.
One NNGO director was kidnapped by an unknown armed group in Sittwe, Rakhine. The whereabouts of the director remain unknown.
Two national INGO aid workers were killed due to a missile strike of the Jabalia refugee camp in the Gaza Strip.

Actor name: Rek Dinka and the Marial Bai/Wun Bai community
Details: One NNGO aid worker was killed during armed clashes between the Rek Dinka and the Marial Bai/Wun Bai community in Pathuon West, Gogrial East county, Warrap State. Nine other civilians were also killed (not counted here).
Two NGO aid workers were abducted when unknown armed men ambushed the convoy they were travelling in. Three vehicles were burnt during the incident.
One female aid worker transporting food and supplies was injured due to shelling from the Russian Armed Forces in Novgorod-Siversky, Chernihiv.

One male national INGO aid worker was killed when a convoy of marked vehicles with authorization to evacuate in Al Wahida, Gaza came under Israeli fire. One other civilian was also killed during the incident (not counted).
One UN staff member was stabbed by an acquaintance at her residence in Johannesburg.
Two male INGO doctors were killed by an airstrike on the Al-Awda hospital in Gaza. A third doctor employed by the state hospital was also killed (not counted here).
One female UN aid worker was killed along with her family during a shelling in Southern Gaza.
One INGO aid worker was killed by allegedly a drone attack on a vehicle in Al-Hasaka governorate. Two other civilians were injured during the attack (not counted).
One off-duty male ICRC driver was killed in Northern Gaza along with other members of his family (not counted here).
Four NGO aid workers were abducted by JNIM militiamen between Tenenkou and Ke-Macina, Mopti region. Two vehicles were sized during the incident.
One NGO aid worker was kidnapped by allegedly JNIM militants between Goudam and Tombouctou. The aid worker was released the next day.

One national LNGO aid worker was injured when unknown actors shot a vehicle transporting injured people between Muse and Mandalay, Shan state. Two aid recipients and a civilian were also injured (not counted). Due to the incident, the NGO suspended activities.
One NNGO aid worker was injured by mortar shelling by Russian Forces during an attack on a food distribution centre in Toretsk city, Donetsk Oblast.

41 UN aid workers have been killed and 5 have been injured during the clashes between the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between November 1 and November 30, 2023. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.
One female national INGO aid worker was killed along with her family in Khan Younis at some point in December 2023.
One national INGO aid worker was shot and killed by unknown armed men between Nawaporuru village and Boma town for unknown reasons.

Three International ICRC aid workers were injured when a convoy of clearly marked vehicles was fired while evacuating civilians from Khartoum to Wad Medani. During the incident, two non-ICRC people were killed, and four people were also injured (not counted).
One national NGO aid worker was wounded when unknown armed men ambushed a private vehicle on the road between Juba and Bor. Two other civilians were also injured (not counted).
One INGO health worker was injured by a shot fired from outside in Al-Awda Hospital, in Gaza.
One male INGO aid worker was killed along with his family by an airstrike in Gaza.

Four UN contracted commercial drivers were kidnapped from an 11 truck convoy travelling in Liban Woreda near Negelle town. Ransom was requested, but after negotiations they were released after 2 days.
One female INGO staff member was killed along with her four children when their home was hit by an explosion in the Nuseirat area, Central Gaza.
One national NGO aid worker was beaten and injured by the Central African Armed Forces (FACA) after accidentally hitting a child when riding his motorbike.
One NNGO aid worker was kidnapped by unknown actors who demanded a ransom to release the aid worker in the Amhara region.
One male national aid worker was shot and wounded by his ex-wife for unknown reasons in Nzara, Western Equatoria.
One UN national aid worker was killed with his family during an aerial bombardment in Gaza City.
One NNGO aid worker was injured and later died after an IED exploded at a police checkpoint in Bay.
One male UN aid worker was assaulted and injured by thee police in Shire, Tigray region.
One aid worker was killed by an Israeli naval ship strike on the Gaza Strip.

31 UN aid workers have been killed during the clashes between the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between December 1 and December 31, 2023. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.
One national INGO aid worker was injured by another aid worker over a disagreement in Malakal, Upper Nile.
One aid worker from the National Red Cross was kidnapped by alleged members of the PMC Wagner Group in Kidal.
An unknown number of aid workers from the Emergency Monitoring Room were beaten and tortured by the Sudanese Armed Forces in Dindar, Sennar state. (Defaulted to two).
One national INGO aid worker was shot and killed by unknown armed actors in Al Dhale, Dhale governorate.
One off-duty INGO driver was killed by unknown armed actors during an attack in Chibanga Village, Mocimboa da Praia. Three other civilians were also killed (not counted).
One NRCS driver was kidnapped by Wagner forces in Kidal. Two other civilians were kidnapped as well. His whereabouts remain unknown.
One UN national staff was injured while passing by the Inca Road, Torit, where two local gangs were clashing.
One INGO security guard was stabbed to death by unknown actors while on duty at the organisation's health facility in Lotukei Payam, Budi County, Eastern Equatoria.
Four national NRCS aid workers were killed when their ambulance was hit by a shell in Gaza. Two other injured civilians were also killed (not counted).
One national Ethiopian Red Cross ambulance driver was shot and killed by unknown actors while on duty in the Central Zone of the Tigray Region.
Three national INGO aid workers were kidnapped by unknown actors while deployed on a project visit in the village of Yeme, Kossa area, North region.
One national head of NGO was severely injured by two unknown armed actors in Ago Hamam town, Deir ez-Zor governorate.
One aid worker was killed by unknown armed men in Semera, Afar region.
Two aid workers were killed by unknown armed men in the Amhara region.
One aid worker was killed by unknown armed actors in the Gambella region.
One male NNGO aid worker was shot and killed by unknown armed men in Sharg An Neel, Khartoum.
One national female UN aid worker was injured when five criminals attacked her to rob her belongings around Loma de la Cruz in Cali, Valle del Cauca.
One national LNGO aid worker was injured when a government soldier shot the vehicle the aid worker was in Qansaley IDP camp, Dolow.
One UN driver was injured by unknown armed men on motorcycles who robbed his personal belongings in Magnambougou Fasso Kanu, Bamako.
One INGO aid worker was injured when the Ethiopian Armed Forces allegedly opened fire into the air in Addis Kidam town, Amhara region.
Three national aid workers were shot and killed by unknown armed men in Sahlat al Banat camp, Raqqa.

One male INGO aid worker was kidnapped in Bundugu, Zamfara, by the Zamfara militia while going to visit his family. The armed group demanded a ransom to free the aid worker. The aid worker was released on February 19.

10 UN aid workers have been killed and 1 UN aid worker has been injured during the clashes between the Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between the 1 and the 31 of January, 2024. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.
Two national NNGO aid workers and one driver were kidnapped by JNIM militants in Bourasso, Kossi. The three personnel were released on February 4th.
Two international INGO aid workers were killed, three international aid workers were injured, and one national aid worker was injured during a drone attack in Beryslav, Kherson Oblast.
One female NNGO aid worker was killed during an airstrike in Shu'a, Babanusa, West Kordofan.
Two male national NRCS aid workers were shot and killed by Occupation Forces close to Al Amal Hospital in Khan Younis.
One female NRCS aid worker was shot and killed inside the organisation building by a sniper in Khan Younis.
One national contractor of an INGO was injured when a landmine exploded while installing a water line in Um Rjem village, Aleppo.
Two national INGO aid workers were killed in Abyei, Warrap.

One INGO aid worker was kidnapped by unknown armed actors from the residence in Lugbe, Abuja, Federal Capital Territory. Another civilian was kidnapped too (not counted). The aid worker was released on February 13.
One male Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid worker was shot and killed, and another injured, while evacuating wounded people near the Baptist Hospital in Gaza.
One NGO aid worker was killed during a bombing attack by the March 23 Movement (M23) in Sake, Masisi, North Kivu.
Two NGO aid workers were abducted by JNIM militiamen in Bagourou, Mopti. Both aid workers were released a day later.

One female international INGO doctor was kidnapped by unknown actors who pretended to be patients at the Saint-Michel hospital in Dono Manga. Her whereabouts remain unknown. One other foreign doctor was also kidnapped but escaped during the incident.
Two national Palestinian Red Crescent Society aid workers were killed when the ambulance they were in was hit in Gaza.
Six aid workers were kidnapped along with their partners by JNIM militants between Koro and Yoro, Mopti. Their whereabouts remain unknown.
One NRCS paramedic was injured during a raid to Kfar Dounine, Nabatieh.
One male INGO aid worker was kidnapped by alleged members of the Rapid Support Forces on the road between Dilling and El Obeid, South Kordofan. The aid worker was released on March 5th.
One INGO aid worker was attacked and injured by alleged members of the Islamic State in West Africa (ISWA) in Bama,  Borno.
At least one aid worker was killed during an attack by the Rapid Support Forces on five different villages in South Kordofan. The exact number of victims is unknown.
One UN focal point was shot and injured by an unidentified Sokoto militia in Gwadabawa, Sokoto.
One male INGO aid worker was killed with a machete at his home by criminals who robbed his personal belongings in Ndokwa West, Delta.
One NNGO aid worker was killed by an unknown person from his community in Pekon, Taunggyi, Shan State.
One male UN agency staff member was killed in Deir Al Balah after his home was hit by an airstrike. Several members of his family were also killed.
One INGO aid worker was shot and killed by unknown armed men close to his home in Baghdad.
One UN national contractor for the Polio Eradication Programme was kidnapped by unknown armed actors in Khanpur.

8 UN aid workers have been killed during the clashes between the Israel Defence Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between the 1st and the 29th of February, 2024. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time.
One UN-contracted driver was shot and injured during an ambush of a convoy of trucks between Abiemnmhom and Mayom, Unity.
One national NGO bodyguard was stabbed to death during a robbery of the NGO office by criminals in Ouagadougou.
One male national INGO aid worker was killed along with his family during an aerial strike in Khirbat al 'Adas, Gaza.
One UN-contracted driver was injured during an ambush by unknown armed men on the road between Bor and Yuai, Jonglei.
One bodyguard was injured, and one bodyguard was kidnapped during an armed incursion to an. INGO base in Birao, Vakanga.

One INGO staff member was killed when the place he and his family were sheltering was hit by an Israeli airstrike. Reports indicate the coordinates of the shelter in Deir Al Balah had been shared with parties to the conflict.
One UN-contracted international driver was killed during an ambush by an unidentified group of youth in Payuel Payam, Jonglei.
One UN aid worker was killed, and 22 UN aid workers were injured during a drone attack on a UN distribution centre in Rafah, Gaza.
One UN-contracted security guard was injured by an IDP who forcibly attempted to enter the Malakal POC compound in Malakal, Upper Nile.
One national INGO aid worker was injured by criminals who entered the home of the aid worker and stole valuable items in Munuki, Central Equatoria.
One international female UN worker was injured by an allegedly homeless person who struck her with an object in Santiago.
Three INGO aid workers were stabbed and injured by one of their colleagues in Damboa, Borno.
Two aid workers were killed during a bombardment of the aid warehouse in Mukhayyam Jabalya refugee camp, Gaza Strip.
One NNGO aid worker was killed by allegedly the Myanmar Armed Forces in Taungoo, Bago. The incident caused program suspension.

City: Al Fihaa, Umm Dom and Al Jarif East
Details: An unknown number of aid workers were kidnapped by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Sharg An Neel, Khartoum. While some were later released, there are other aid workers whose whereabouts remain unknown. (Defaulted to two).
Two male PRCS staff members were shot and killed as they attempted to find a safe route for ambulance evacuations from the Al Amal Hospital in Khan Yunis.
Two INGO volunteers were injured during an IDP protest at an aid distribution in Monguno, Borno State. Two other civilians were also injured (not counted).
One national UN aid worker was killed during an airstrike that hit his home in Deir ez-Zor.
One LNGO ambulance was injured when an unidentified armed group attacked the vehicle in Ka Mar Saing, Thaton, Mon state.

According to the NRCS, an additional 9 staff members have been killed in the Gaza Strip since October 7, 2023 until March 29th. Further details on the individual incidents is not available at this time.
Three national NNGO aid workers were kidnapped by allegedly Murle Tribesman between Bor and Gumuruk, Jonglei. Their whereabouts remain unknown.
One national INGO aid worker was shot and killed in his home by an unknown armed actor in Phom, Fangak, Jonglei.
One ICRC driver was killed by unknown armed men in Goma, North Kivu.

13 UN aid workers have been killed during the clashes between the Israel Defence Forces (IDF) and Hamas in the Gaza Strip between the 1st and the 30th of March, 2024. Reports indicate most fatalities are due to aerial attacks. Exact dates and locations of those killed and the extent of the injuries are unknown at this time. (One fatality coded on a separate incident).

According to UN agency reports, an additional 9 UN agency staff members were killed in the Gaza Strip between March 31 and April 28, 2024. Further information on their exact whereabouts or the means of attack is unknown at this time.
One NNGO aid worker was shot and killed by the Zamfara militia in Maradun, Zamfara.

7 INGO staff members, including 1 national and 6 international staff, were killed in an Israeli Defence Forces strike in Central Gaza, as their aid convoy left a warehouse. One additional national INGO staff was injured. According to official statements, the vehicles were all clearly marked and information on their movements had been shared with parties to the conflict. Israel has taken responsibility for the attack, calling it "unintentional." The INGO has suspended all operations in the area.
One INGO staff member was seriously injured after an airstrike hit a mosque in Central Gaza, Deir al-Balah.
One international INGO aid worker and one national INGO aid worker were killed by Al Shabaab militants when on their way to deliver food assistance in Mogadishu.
One INGO manager was kidnapped by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Kereneik, West Darfur, who demanded a ransom for his release. The aid worker was on April 9.
One NNGO driver was killed by ISWAP along the Maine Soroa road, Diffa.

One national NRCS aid worker was kidnapped in Mambasa by the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) for unknown reasons. The body of the aid worker was found on April 22 in the forest of Kindiasa village, Ituri.
One NNGO aid worker was killed during an airstrike allegedly by Myanmar Armed Forces in Pekon, Taunggyi, Shan State.
One male UN aid worker was killed in the Netzarim corridor, Gaza.
One male PRCS paramedic was shot and killed by Israeli Settlers while providing medical assistance to victims in Al Sawiya, West Bank.
Three aid workers were injured while delivering aid due to a drone strike in Sotnytskyi Kozachok, Kharkiv.
One aid worker was kidnapped from an NGO bakery by the Southern Transitional Council in Aden.
An unknown number of Red Cross aid workers were kidnapped over allegations of smuggling an international civilian by QSD militants in Al-Hasakah. Number of aid workers defaulted to two.

According to UN agency reports, an additional 10 UN agency staff members were killed in the Gaza Strip between April 30 and May 31, 2024. Further information on their exact whereabouts or the means of attack is unknown at this time.
One NNGO contracted security guard was injured when a group of criminals attacked and robbed a relief distribution centre in Saboti, Trans Nzoia.
Two NGO staff were injured when an Al Shabaab IED exploded in the Dolow-Beled Xaawo road, Dolow.
One NGO aid worker was killed when an IED exploded in Kossi, Boucle du Mouhoun. Five other civilians died in the incident.
One NGO aid worker was killed during a JNIM attack on an IDP camp in Goubr, Yatenga. At least 71 other people were killed during the attack. (not counted here).
One NGO staff was shot and injured by a staff colleague over an altercation at their office.
Two ICRC drivers were killed and three ICRC aid workers were injured by unknown armed men in Sharg Aj Jabal, South Darfur.
One INGO staff member was killed during intercommunal clashes in Pibor town. Humanitarian programs were temporarily suspended.
One national INGO aid worker was found dead in a public space in Wunkok, Greater Pibor Area. The aid worker left his duty station five days before to go to Pibor.

One UN contracted security guard was shot and killed when the public transport bus he was travelling in came under fire from the police. Four other civilians were killed and numerous injured (not counted here).
One national NRCS aid worker was shot and killed and one national NRCS was injured by unknown armed men when collecting data for humanitarian assistance in Abu Haraz, Al Jazirah.

One aid worker was killed when the roof of an INGO-supported hospital collapsed due to an aerial attack of allegedly the Sudanese Armed Forces in Al Fasher, North Darfur. Two other civilians died during the incident (not counted).
One UN-contracted national driver was killed and one UN international aid worker was injured in an aerial attack in the east of Rafah, Gaza.
One boat driver from an INGO was injured by the SPLA-IO along the Tonga - Atar corridor, Panyikang County, Upper Nile. The INGO suspended movements through the corridor after the incident.

One international staff member of a UN agency that supports humanitarian programming was killed and another international was injured when their marked UN vehicle was hit by gunshots in Rafah on route to a hospital.
One UN agency staff member was hit by a stray bullet in Beirut near his home. He was taken to the hospital and is in stable condition.
One NNGO aid worker was kidnapped by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Janoub Al Hizam, Khartoum. His/her whereabouts remain unknown.

One male UN aid worker was kidnapped by an unidentified NSAG at the Keberomeda IDP site, Gondar, Amhara. Two other civilians were kidnapped as well (not counted). The three people were released on May 27 after their families paid a ransom.
One female national INGO aid worker was beaten and injured by a family member for unknown reasons in Malakal POC camp.
One INGO director was taken from the organisation's office by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) for unknown reasons in Zalingi, Central Darfur. His whereabouts remain unknown.
One UN driver was taken to an unknown location by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) at the Jabal stop in Nyala, South Darfur. He was released several days later.
One national UN aid worker was injured along with his wife and his sister when armed criminals broke into the sister's house and robbed multiple personal belongings in Luanda.
Three UN aid workers were kidnapped during an ambush along the Okeho-Iseyin road, Oyo state. The three aid workers were released on the 24 of May after the payment of a ransom.
One National Red Crescent Society female aid worker was shot and killed by a stray bullet while she was on duty at the Southern Hospital.
One male national NRCS aid worker was killed in his home during an aerial bombardment in Rafah, Gaza Strip.
One aid worker was killed and at least one other aid worker was injured in Gondar, Amhara region.
One LNGO vice-chairman was kidnapped by the Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army (MNDAA) in Muse city, Shan. His whereabouts remain unknown.
One male INGO aid worker was killed when a shell hit his home in Al Fasher, North Darfur.
Two NGO aid workers were injured during a missile strike in Kharviv City.
One NRCS aid worker was shot and killed by unknown armed men in Er Rahad, North Kordofan.
Two aid workers were killed and one aid worker was injured in an aerial bombardment at the Kuwaiti Hospital in Rafah, Gaza Strip. The hospital ceased operations following the attack.
One UN-contracted driver was injured when unknown actors ambushed the truck in the N'dele-Birao axis, Gordil, Birao.
Two INGO aid workers were injured when unknown armed men shot at their vehicle between Boguila and Bomissi village, in Ouham.
Two Palestinian Red Crescent paramedics were killed during an aerial attack on their ambulance in the area of Tel Sultan, Rafah, in Gaza.

Actor name: Islamic State of West Africa Province
Details: One NGO aid worker was kidnapped at a checkpoint by allegedly ISWAP militants in the Monguno-Gajiram road, Borno state. two other civilians were also kidnapped and another civilian was injured (not counted).
One male international aid worker was injured in Vovchans'k, Kharkiv.

According to UN agency reports, one additional UN agency staff member was killed in the Gaza Strip between the 2nd and the 30th of June, 2024. Further information on the exact whereabouts or the means of attack is unknown at this time.
One NGO aid worker was kidnapped by an unknown OAG in the South-West region. The aid worker was released a week later.
One female NGO aid worker was shot and wounded by armed men allegedly over a familiar dispute in Farah. Another civilian was also injured (not counted here).
One aid worker was killed due to a Russian aerial attack in Toretsk, Donetsk Oblast.
One female NGO aid worker was killed by unknown armed men at her hotel while on duty in Pweto, Haut-Katanga.

Two INGO aid workers were killed when a group of armed demonstrators opened fire on a convoy of 15 aid workers who were trying to reach Butembo, North Kivu. The demonstrators confined and physically assaulted the aid workers, but the rest of the group managed to escape (not counted).
Two INGO aid workers were injured when protesters threw stones at the ambulance they were in while responding to casualties from the protest.
One NNGO was injured by unknown armed men who were asking for the funding of the project in Bahri, Khartoum.
One NNGO was shot and killed by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Sharg An Neel, Khartoum.
One LNGO bodyguard was injured by an IED planted by Al Shabaab at the entrance of the office in Baidoa, Baydhaba, Bay.
One UN-contracted individual was injured during an ambush by unknown individuals between Mabiourand Wernyol village, Duk county.
One INGO aid worker was injured during an armed robbery of a compound of aid workers' apartments in Gwarinpa, Abuja.

At least two UN aid workers and one INGO aid worker were abducted by Houthi Forces in Al Hodeidah due to accusations of espionage. Abductions have been documented in at least 5 different locations in the country. The exact number of aid workers abducted is unknown.

At least two UN aid workers and one INGO aid worker were abducted by Houthi Forces in Sana'a due to accusations of espionage. Abductions have been documented in at least 5 different locations in the country. The exact number of aid workers abducted is unknown.

At least two UN aid workers and one INGO aid worker were abducted by Houthi Forces in Amran due to accusations of espionage. Abductions have been documented in at least 5 different locations in the country. The exact number of aid workers abducted is unknown.

At least two UN aid workers and one INGO aid worker were abducted by Houthi Forces in Hajjah due to accusations of espionage. Abductions have been documented in at least 5 different locations in the country. The exact number of aid workers abducted is unknown.

At least two UN aid workers and one INGO aid worker were abducted by Houthi Forces in Sa'dah due to accusations of espionage. Abductions have been documented in at least 5 different locations in the country. The exact number of aid workers abducted is unknown.
One national male UN aid worker was wounded when an unknown individual shot at other people in Gambella. Six other civilians were also wounded (not counted).
One female INGO aid worker was killed with her family during an aerial bombardment of her home in Deir Al Balah, Gaza Strip.

One UN aid worker was kidnapped by Houthi forces in Sana'a along with other individuals from international organisations and diplomatic bodies (not counted here). Houthis have kidnapped an unknown number of people over claims of Western espionage.
Eight male NNGO aid workers were killed during a Rapid Support Forces' airstrike on a community kitchen in El Fasher, North Darfur.
One female national INGO aid worker was injured in a commercial vehicle by unknown armed actors along the Kapoeta-Torit road, Eastern Equatoria.
One national INGO aid worker was injured when criminal actors entered his house in Yambio Town, Western Equatoria.
One NRCS paramedic was injured while transporting a patient in an ambulance in Jenin, West Bank.
One national UN-contracted bodyguard was stabbed and injured by unknown actors when on his way to Bentiu IDP camp, Unity.
One NNGO driver was injured when the bus he was driving for humanitarian purposes was attacked in Sumy, Sumy Oblast. Three other civilians were also injured. (not counted here)
One UN national aid worker was injured with a knife by unknown actors when going to pay salaries to polio vaccination staff in Losite Payam, Ikotos County. The perpetrators robbed the money.
One female NNGO aid worker was killed by a stray bullet in the Abu Shouk Camp, El Fasher, North Darfur.
One national aid worker was killed by shelling of the INGO supported Al Nao Hospital in Omdurman, Khartoum. Two other civilians were killed and 27 injured during the attack (not counted).
One NRCS aid worker was kidnapped by Al Shabaab militants near Luuqjelow, Beledweyne, Hiraan. The aid worker was released the next day after a ransom was paid.

One LNGO ambulance driver was shot and injured by allegedly Myanmar military men when transporting an ill person from Myingyan town to Sa Kha Ma village, Mandalay region. The patient was also shot and killed (not counted).
One NNGO aid worker was abducted by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Jebel Awlia, Khartoum. The aid worker's whereabouts remain unknown.
One INGO national staff member was killed in an attack along with 5 other civilians as he cycled to work in Gaza City.
One INGO aid worker was kidnapped by Houthi Forces in Sana'a over accusations of espionage. The whereabouts of the aid worker remain unknown.

Three male LNGO aid workers were shot and disappeared from the ambulance in which they were transporting a patient in Mogoke, Mandalay. The ambulance was found damaged, while the whereabouts of the aid workers remain unknown.
Two off-duty INGO aid workers were killed, and one NNGO volunteer was injured during a suicide bomb at a wedding in Gwonza, Borno State.
Two national INGO aid workers were killed and two national INGO aid workers were kidnapped in an ambush to a convoy in Butembo, North Kivu. The whereabouts of the kidnapped staff remain unknown.
One NNGO aid worker was killed by IS members during an ambush on a truck carrying aid in Mute, Palma, Cabo Delgado.
One NNGO aid worker was killed when criminals vandalised an NGO office and stole cash in DRC.
One NNGO aid worker was killed by unknown actors while off duty at his home in Zamfara.
Five NGO aid workers were abducted from a project site by unknown armed men who demanded the project be expanded in the Northwest region. All of them were released a day later.
One NGO aid worker was shot and injured by the Islamic State while moving on a public bus in Tillaberi region.
One NNGO aid worker was injured when unknown men assaulted a civilian vehicle the aid worker was in in Balkh. Another NGO aid worker was also in the vehicle but was not injured.

According to UN agency reports, an additional 10 UN agency staff members were killed in the Gaza Strip between July 1st and 31st, 2024. Further information on their exact whereabouts or the means of attack is unknown at this time.
Four NNGO aid workers were killed when they were just released after being captured and tortured at Karem Abu Salem crossing, Rafah, Gaza.
One on-duty NRCS aid worker was killed while in Sennar.
One male UN aid worker was injured in his eye by an unaffiliated actor in Warsaw.
Two aid workers were killed when the escalation of clans conflict led to the torch of an IDPs' settlement in Luuq, Gedo.
One aid worker was shot and injured by a government soldier in Garbahaarey, Gedo.
One on-duty NRCS aid worker was killed by unknown armed men in Sennar.
One INGO aid worker and three other aid workers were killed during an aerial bombardment on a warehouse in Gaza.
Two INGO aid workers were killed by unknown armed men in Taboye town, Gao.
Two aid workers from an INGO implementing partner were killed due to a drone attack in Gaza.
One female INGO aid worker was injured by the relative of a beneficiary at a warehouse in Akoto, Jonglei.
Two INGO contractors were injured due to a strike on a project site in Nuseirat Camp, Gaza.

One female UN aid worker was injured when a police officer shot at the motorcycle she was on during a misunderstanding in the Wadajir area of Mogadishu, Banadir. The motorcycle driver was also injured (not counted).
One aid volunteer was injured during an allegedly Russian drone attack in Kherson. One other civilian was also injured during the attack (not counted).
One male NNGO aid worker was kidnapped and later killed by unknown actors who demanded a ransom in Dawunt Woreda, North Wello Zone, Amhara.
One INGO driver was injured when the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) opened fire at the truck of the organisation containing food baskets in Khan Younis, Gaza.
One INGO aid worker was injured due to a gunfire attack in Khan Younis, Gaza.
One INGO aid worker and one driver were kidnapped by unknown armed men on the road between Moro and Yei, Central Equatoria. Both aid workers were released unharmed on July 29.
One male LNGO aid worker was shot and injured while on duty by an unknown actor in Lashio, Shan North.
One aid worker was injured when a drone struck the car in which aid was being delivered in Antonivka, Kherson.

One aid worker was killed and one aid worker was tortured by allegedly the Myanmar Armed Forces after being arrested during a food distribution in Lashio, Shan. The injured aid worker was freed on August 3rd.
Two male NNGO aid workers were shot and killed by unknown actors in Sennar state.
One Palestinian Red Crescent paramedic later died due to shrapnel wounds he suffered while evacuating wounded in the Balata Refugee Camp, Nablus, West Bank.
The founder of an NGO was shot and killed by unknown armed men in Soba East town, Sharg An Neel, Khartoum.
Two aid workers were kidnapped by unknown armed men when transporting medical supplies in two motorbikes along the Yei-Maridi road, Central Equatoria. Their whereabouts remain unknown.

Five NGO aid workers were abducted and injured by unknown armed actors in the Northwest region while conducting an assessment. The armed actors accused the aid workers of not having authorisation to be there. The aid workers were released a day later.
One NGO driver was abducted by M23 men in North Kivu. The aid worker was released a day later.
Two NGO aid workers and one security guard were killed by unknown armed men who attacked the NGO office in Benue.

According to UN agency reports, an additional 10 UN agency staff members were killed in the Gaza Strip between August 1st and 31st, 2024. Further information on their exact whereabouts or the means of attack is unknown at this time.
One NNGO aid worker was injured by an armed individual in Chukudum, Budi, Eastern Equatoria.
Three aid workers from an INGO-supported hospital were killed during a shelling from the Rapid Support Forces in Al Fasher, North Darfur.
One national UN aid worker was shot and injured by unknown armed actors in Munuki Payam, Juba.
One male aid worker was killed by a stray bullet while trying to restore power lines in Khartoum North.
One INGO aid worker was shot and injured and three other INGO aid workers were critically beaten and injured during an armed robbery in Wulu, Lakes state.
One off-duty male national INGO aid worker was killed close to Deir Al-Balah, Gaza Strip.
Three aid workers were killed and at least three aid workers were abducted during a Boko Haram attack in Rann, Born State. At least 11 people were killed during the attack.
One national NNGO director was shot and killed by unknown armed actors in Makurdi, Benue.
One national male UN aid worker was injured when criminals attacked and robbed him while he was on transit in his motorcycle in Avenue des Martyres, Bangui.
One INGO health worker was kidnapped by allegedly Wagner members in Kidal. The aid worker was released on August 14.
Two INGO aid workers were injured and later died during a drone attack on a water tank by allegedly the Russian Armed Forces in Kherson.

An unknown number of aid workers were injured during a shooting by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in a communal kitchen in Shambat, North Khartoum. (Defaulted to two aid workers). The kitchen was looted.
One NGO aid worker was injured due to an artillery strike on a humanitarian facility by allegedly the Syrian Armed Forces in Idlib.
One national NGO aid worker was killed during an intercommunal clashes in Dhusamareb, Galguduud.
Two female NNGO aid workers were killed during an aerial bombardment by the SAF in Al Tuwisha, North Darfur.
One LNGO aid worker was shot and killed by armed men from the Digil-Jiido clan militia in Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle.

Two aid workers were abducted by the Rapid Support Forces during an attack on the project site in Al Jarif West, Khartoum. One of the aid workers was killed during captivity, while the whereabouts of the second remains unknown.
At least one NGO aid worker was killed in a complex attack from JNIM in which more than 100 civilians were killed in Barsalogho, Sanmatenga, North Kivu.
One national NRCS aid worker was killed due to shelling at the local hospital in El-Daein, East Darfur, while on duty.
An unspecified number of humanitarian workers were ambushed and injured by unknown armed men along National Road 3, Kalonge town, Kabare territory, South Kivu. (Defaulted to two aid workers).
One UN aid worker was killed by unknown actors in Ossud, Nzerekore.
Three Palestinian Red Crescent medical workers were injured when Israeli soldiers opened fire on their ambulance in Jenin, West Bank.
One NNGO aid worker was killed by a stray bullet in Al-Hasaka.
Two female NGO aid workers were injured when an Al-Shabaab-planted IED exploded on a project site in Jubaland.
One male NGO contractor was abducted by unknown armed actors in Segou. The aid worker escaped from his captors the next day.
One NGO aid worker was injured during a robbery on a private home in Maroua, Far North region.
One national INGO aid worker was kidnapped and held captive at the INGO office in Central Darfur. After five days, the aid worker was released.
One NNGO aid worker was killed by unknown actors in Khartoum.

According to UN agency reports, an additional 12 UN agency staff members were killed in the Gaza Strip between September 1st and 30th, 2024. Further information on their exact whereabouts or the means of attack is unknown at this time. (6 killings from this incident added in a separate ID).
One INGO health driver was killed by allegedly collaborating with JNIM militants in Djibo, Soum. Three other civilians were also killed during the incident (not counted here).

Two NGO aid workers were kidnapped by allegedly the National Salvation Forces and a third NGO aid worker was later abducted as well when negotiating the release of the first two in Yei, Juba. Their whereabouts remain unknown.
One NNGO from a UN implementing partner was killed during a missile attack on Lviv city, Lviv region. Seven other civilians were killed and 64 injured during the attack (not counted).
One INGO aid worker was killed and two INGO aid workers were kidnapped by an unknown armed group in the Lake region. The whereabouts of the missing aid workers are unknown.
One UN driver was shot and injured when IES members ambushed and shot the marked vehicle, and later stole it in Dori, Sahel region. The vehicle was found a day later.
Six UN aid workers were killed during an aerial bombardment on a school in Nuseirat Camp, Gaza Strip. Twelve other civilians also died during the incident (not counted).
One INGO project manager was abducted by allegedly the Houthi Forces in Sa'dah. The whereabouts of the aid worker remain unknown.
One UN driver was injured when armed men shot at the vehicle he was driving in Dori, Seno, Sahel.
Three ICRC aid workers were killed, and two were wounded due to a shelling attack that hit an aid distribution site in Virolyubivka, Donetsk.
One UN aid worker was shot and killed on the roof of his home in the West Bank.
One UN aid worker was abducted by allegedly the Houthi Forces in Sana'a. The whereabouts of the aid worker remain unknown.
One INGO director was shot and killed by members of an unknown armed group who demanded the payment of a toll on a roadblock in Cholobero, Kalonge.

One INGO aid worker and one NNGO aid worker were kidnapped by alleged members of the National Salvation Front in Yei, Central Equatoria. The perpetrators also stole the belongings of the personnel. Both aid workers were released the following day. The INGO suspended operations in Yei following the incident.
One NNGO aid worker was killed by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Khartoum.
One female UN aid worker was killed by a missile that hit her home in Beqaar, eastern Lebanon. One of her children was also killed during the incident (not counted).
One male UN-contracted worker was killed during the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) airstrikes in Tyre, South governorate.
One INGO-contracted security guard was killed by an unknown armed individual at the entrance of a medical facility in Hiyala, Torit, Eastern Equatoria.
Three NRCS aid workers were injured while on duty during an airstrike in Kramatorsk, Donestk.
One NNGO volunteer was killed during a shelling from unknown actors in Khartoum.
One NNGO chairman was shot and killed by unidentified armed men in Ngazun, Myingyan, Mandalay.
One female NNGO aid worker was shot and killed by Hamas militants in Khan Younis, Gaza Strip.
Three NNGO aid workers were killed by unknown armed men in Ngazun, Myingyan, Mandalay.
One male NNGO aid worker was killed by a stray bullet in El Fasher, North Darfur.

One male national INGO aid worker was shot and killed by unknown armed men while moving on public transportation in Yilmana Densa, West Gojam, Amhara Region. Two other civilians were killed during the same incident.
One off-duty male INGO aid worker was injured during a drone strike in Rafid, Western Beqaa.
One male INGO aid worker was killed along with his family due to an airstrike in Tyre, South region.
An unknown number of aid workers were attacked and injured by Houthi Forces snipers while assisting displaced people in Wadi Ahamah, Al Musaymir, Lahj. (Defaulted to two injured aid workers).
One NGO aid worker was abducted by the Mai Mai militia, who accused the aid worker of collaborating with security forces. The whereabouts of the aid worker remain unknown.
One NGO-contracted driver was abducted by criminals in the Kano region. His whereabouts remain unknown.
One male NGO aid worker was stabbed and injured by criminals while returning home along he Kaita-Katsina road, Kano region.
One NGO aid worker was abducted by JNIM militants at an irregular checkpoint in Matiakoli, Gourma. The aid worker was released two days later.
One NGO aid worker was abducted at a private home by JNIM militants in Tapoa, East region.
Three NGO aid workers were abducted by unknown armed men who claimed that they were not authorised to be in the territory in Maubu, Northwest. The aid workers were released in November.
One LNGO was abducted by unknown armed men who accused the aid worker of running a project without their permission in the Northwest region. The aid worker was released 20 days later.

According to UN agency reports, an additional 12 UN agency staff members were killed in the Gaza Strip between October 1st and 31st, 2024. Further information on their exact whereabouts or the means of attack is unknown at this time.
One NGO driver was abducted by unknown armed men at an illegal checkpoint in Magazu, Zamfara. The driver escaped one month and a half later.
One male UN aid worker was injured when a criminal entered his home and attempted to rob personal belongings in Kingston, Jamaica.
Three different PRCS teams were attacked by gunfire in the Balata Refugee Camp, West Bank, resulting in the injuries of 6 staff.
An unknown number of NRCS aid workers were killed by the Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) in Bapere district, Lubero territory, North Kivu. (Defaulted to two)
Five NRCS were injured by shelling in Taybeh, Marjayoun, Nabatieh governorate.
One female NNGO aid worker was killed on her way to a project site by shelling from the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Omduman, Khartoum.
One female NRCS aid worker was killed during a bombardment in Baalbek.
One UN aid worker was injured during an airstrike in Jiye, Mount Lebanon.
One male NNGO aid worker was shot and killed during confrontations between the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and the Sudanese Armed Forces in Al Foulah, West Kordofan.
One UN aid worker was killed during a drone attack in Jabalia camp, Gaza Strip.
Three NGO aid workers were injured during a drone attack when transporting aid from Iraq to Lebanon in Hasyaa, Homs.
One NNGO was killed, and one NNGO was injured during a drone strike on their car in Kurakhivka, Pokrovsk, Donetsk Oblast.
One aid worker was targeted, shot, and killed by Joint Forces soldiers in Al Fasher, North Darfur.
At least three aid workers were killed and one aid worker injured when a vehicle was hit by an airstrike in Khan Younis. Defaulted to three aid workers killed and one injured.
One male INGO aid worker was killed due to shrapnel shots in Jabalia, Northern Gaza.
One NNGO aid worker was kidnapped and tortured by allegedly the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in an unclear location. The aid worker later died.
One INGO contractor was abducted by unknown armed men in a residence in Kurba, Katsina. Five other civilians were also abducted (not counted here).
Three male NNGO aid workers were shot and killed when men affiliated with the RSF attacked them to loot the project site in Hajar al Asal, River Nile.
Four NRCS aid workers were injured in an airstrike in Srobbin, Nabatieh governorate.

An unknown number of INGO aid workers were injured during an attack from unknown armed men in Nampalari, Niono, Segou. Some goods were stolen during the attack. The INGO suspended programs in the area after the incident. (Defaulted to two aid workers)
Five NNGO security guards were injured during an aerial attack in Al Mashro, East Rafah, Gaza Strip.
Two NRCS aid workers were shot and injured during a rescue mission in Jouaiya, Tyre, South governorate.
One INGO driver was beaten by unknown armed men in Khan Younis, Gaza Strip.
One INGO aid worker was stabbed and injured by unknown men on a motorcycle along the Kaita-Katsina road, Katsina region.
One female INGO aid worker was killed during an airstrike in Gaza.
Four NNGO aid workers were killed in an airstrike when on a marked vehicle in Khuza'a, Gaza Strip.
Three ICRC aid workers were injured during airstrikes in Nabatieh.
Three NRCS paramedics were injured by shrapnel when arriving to assist injured people in Nabatieh.
One male NNGO aid worker was killed during a drone strike in West Kordofan.
One INGO aid worker was shot and injured by unknown armed men along the road Torit-Magwi, Torit, Eastern Equatoria.
One INGO aid worker was killed during a military operation in Khan Younis, Gaza Strip. At least 33 people were killed in the same incident (not counted).
One UN aid worker was injured when an unknown gang attacked a UN helicopter in Grande Ravine, West.
One female NNGO aid worker was killed by a RSF artillery shelling in El Fasher, North Darfur
One NNGO aid worker was killed by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Abu Jalfa, Al Jazirah.
An unknown number of NNGO aid workers were shot and injured during a Rapid Support Forces (RSF) raid in Tambool, Al Jazirah. (Defaulted to two)
